INTERVENTIONAL PULMONOLOGY OPERATIVE REPORT

DATE OF PROCEDURE: [Date] CC Referred Physician: Self-referred

INDICATION FOR OPERATION 67-year-old female who presents with mediastinal adenopathy. The nature, purpose, risks, benefits, and alternatives to Bronchoscopy were discussed with the patient in detail.

CONSENT Obtained before the procedure. Indications, potential complications, and alternatives were discussed with the patient or surrogate. The patient wished to proceed and informed consent was obtained.

PREOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS
R59.9 Enlarged lymph nodes, unspecified

POSTOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS
R59.9 Enlarged lymph nodes, unspecified
Malignant cells consistent with Adenocarcinoma noted on ROSE

PROCEDURE
Therapeutic aspiration (initial episode)
Diagnostic bronchoscopy with Bronchoalveolar lavage (BAL)
EBUS sampling 3 or more nodes

ATTENDING Dr. Chen
ASSISTANT [Fellow name]
SUPPORT STAFF RN: [Name] RT: [Name]

ANESTHESIA General Anesthesia

MONITORING Pulse oximetry, heart rate, telemetry, and blood pressure were continuously monitored by an independent trained observer throughout the procedure.

INSTRUMENTATION Linear EBUS, Disposable Bronchoscope.

ESTIMATED BLOOD LOSS Minimum
COMPLICATIONS None

PROCEDURE IN DETAIL After the successful induction of anesthesia, a timeout was performed (confirming the patient's name, procedure type, and procedure location).
Patient position: [Supine]

Initial Airway Inspection: Normal appearing airway anatomy and mucosa bilaterally to the segmental level.

Therapeutic Aspiration Successful therapeutic aspiration was performed to clean out the Trachea and bilateral mainstems from mucus, blood, and blood clots.

EBUS STAGING The EBUS bronchoscope was introduced. All lymph node stations were assessed.
Technique: Only lymph nodes measuring ≥5 mm in short axis were sampled.
Sampling was performed by transbronchial needle aspiration using a 22-gauge needle.

Lymph Nodes Inspected: 4R, 4L, 7, 11Rs, 11Ri, 11L.

Stations Sampled:

Station 4R:
Size/Appearance: ≥10 mm on CT and enlarged and necrotic center.
Sampling: 4 EBUS-guided TBNA biopsies obtained.
ROSE: Preliminary cytology reported as adequate and suggestive of Malignant cells consistent with Adenocarcinoma.

Station 7 (Subcarinal):
Size/Appearance: ≥10 mm on CT and enlarged and necrotic center.
Sampling: 4 EBUS-guided TBNA biopsies obtained.
ROSE: Preliminary cytology reported as adequate and suggestive of Malignant cells consistent with Adenocarcinoma.

Station 4L:
Size/Appearance: ≥10 mm on CT and enlarged and necrotic center.
Sampling: 4 EBUS-guided TBNA biopsies obtained.
ROSE: Preliminary cytology reported as inadequate or blood only.

Overall ROSE Diagnosis: Malignant cells consistent with Adenocarcinoma.
Final Results: Pending.

Bronchoalveolar Lavage (BAL) Bronchial alveolar lavage was performed at the Superior Segment of LUL.
Instilled 100 cc of NS, suction returned with 80 cc of NS.
Samples sent for Cell Count, Microbiology (Cultures/Viral/Fungal), and Cytology.

Completion The patient tolerated the procedure well.
There were no immediate complications. At the conclusion of the operation, the patient was extubated in the operating room and transported to the recovery room in stable condition.

SPECIMENS
EBUS-TBNA: Station 4R, Station 7 (Subcarinal), Station 4L
LUL Bronchoalveolar lavage

IMPRESSION / PLAN
67-year-old female who presents for bronchoscopy for mediastinal adenopathy.
EBUS-TBNA performed on stations Station 4R, Station 7 (Subcarinal), Station 4L; ROSE suggestive of Malignancy at sampled stations.
BAL performed in LUL.
Follow up bronchoscopic lab work.

INDICATION FOR OPERATION 59-year-old male who presents with lymphadenopathy. The nature, purpose, risks, benefits, and alternatives to Bronchoscopy were discussed with the patient in detail.

CONSENT Obtained before the procedure. Indications, potential complications, and alternatives were discussed with the patient or surrogate. The patient wished to proceed and informed consent was obtained.

PREOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS
R59.0 Localized enlarged lymph nodes

POSTOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS
R59.0 Localized enlarged lymph nodes
Granulomas noted on ROSE

PROCEDURE
Therapeutic aspiration (initial episode)
Diagnostic bronchoscopy with Bronchoalveolar lavage (BAL)
EBUS sampling 3 or more nodes

ATTENDING Dr. Patel
ASSISTANT [Fellow name]
SUPPORT STAFF RN: [Name] RT: [Name]

ANESTHESIA General Anesthesia

MONITORING Pulse oximetry, heart rate, telemetry, and blood pressure were continuously monitored by an independent trained observer throughout the procedure.

INSTRUMENTATION Linear EBUS, Disposable Bronchoscope.

ESTIMATED BLOOD LOSS Minimum
COMPLICATIONS None

PROCEDURE IN DETAIL After the successful induction of anesthesia, a timeout was performed (confirming the patient's name, procedure type, and procedure location).
Patient position: [Supine]

Initial Airway Inspection: Normal appearing airway anatomy and mucosa bilaterally to the segmental level.

Therapeutic Aspiration Successful therapeutic aspiration was performed to clean out the Trachea and bilateral mainstems from mucus, blood, and blood clots.

EBUS STAGING The EBUS bronchoscope was introduced. All lymph node stations were assessed.
Technique: Only lymph nodes measuring ≥5 mm in short axis were sampled.
Sampling was performed by transbronchial needle aspiration using a 22-gauge needle.

Lymph Nodes Inspected: 4R, 4L, 7, 11Rs, 11Ri, 11L.

Stations Sampled:

Station 4R:
Size/Appearance: ≥10 mm on CT and hypermetabolic via PET-CT.
Sampling: 4 EBUS-guided TBNA biopsies obtained.
ROSE: Preliminary cytology reported as adequate and suggestive of Granulomas.

Station 7 (Subcarinal):
Size/Appearance: ≥10 mm on CT and hypermetabolic via PET-CT.
Sampling: 4 EBUS-guided TBNA biopsies obtained.
ROSE: Preliminary cytology reported as adequate and suggestive of Granulomas.

Station 4L:
Size/Appearance: ≥10 mm on CT and hypermetabolic via PET-CT.
Sampling: 4 EBUS-guided TBNA biopsies obtained.
ROSE: Preliminary cytology reported as inadequate or blood only.

Overall ROSE Diagnosis: Granulomas.
Final Results: Pending.

Bronchoalveolar Lavage (BAL) Bronchial alveolar lavage was performed at the Lateral Segment of RML (RB4) and Medial Segment of RML (RB5).
Instilled 100 cc of NS, suction returned with 92 cc of NS.
Samples sent for Cell Count, Microbiology (Cultures/Viral/Fungal), and Cytology.

Completion The patient tolerated the procedure well.
There were no immediate complications. At the conclusion of the operation, the patient was extubated in the operating room and transported to the recovery room in stable condition.

SPECIMENS
EBUS-TBNA: Station 4R, Station 7 (Subcarinal), Station 4L
RML Bronchoalveolar lavage

59-year-old male who presents for bronchoscopy for lymphadenopathy.
EBUS-TBNA performed on stations Station 4R, Station 7 (Subcarinal), Station 4L; ROSE suggestive of Granulomas at sampled stations.
BAL performed in RML.
Follow up bronchoscopic lab work.

DATE OF PROCEDURE: [Date] CC Referred Physician: Self-referred

INDICATION FOR OPERATION 59-year-old male who presents with lymphadenopathy. The nature, purpose, risks, benefits, and alternatives to Bronchoscopy were discussed with the patient in detail.

CONSENT Obtained before the procedure. Indications, potential complications, and alternatives were discussed with the patient or surrogate. The patient wished to proceed and informed consent was obtained.

PREOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS
R59.0 Localized enlarged lymph nodes

POSTOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS
R59.0 Localized enlarged lymph nodes
Granulomas noted on ROSE

PROCEDURE
Therapeutic aspiration (initial episode)
Diagnostic bronchoscopy with Bronchoalveolar lavage (BAL)
EBUS sampling 3 or more nodes

ATTENDING Dr. Rodriguez
ASSISTANT [Fellow name]
SUPPORT STAFF RN: [Name] RT: [Name]

ANESTHESIA General Anesthesia

MONITORING Pulse oximetry, heart rate, telemetry, and blood pressure were continuously monitored by an independent trained observer throughout the procedure.

INSTRUMENTATION Linear EBUS, Disposable Bronchoscope.

ESTIMATED BLOOD LOSS Minimum
COMPLICATIONS None

PROCEDURE IN DETAIL After the successful induction of anesthesia, a timeout was performed (confirming the patient's name, procedure type, and procedure location).
Patient position: [Supine]

Initial Airway Inspection: Normal appearing airway anatomy and mucosa bilaterally to the segmental level.

Therapeutic Aspiration Successful therapeutic aspiration was performed to clean out the Trachea (Middle 1/3), Trachea (Distal 1/3), Right Mainstem, Bronchus Intermedius, Left Mainstem, Carina from mucus, blood, and blood clots.

EBUS STAGING The EBUS bronchoscope was introduced. All lymph node stations were assessed.
Technique: Only lymph nodes measuring ≥5 mm in short axis were sampled.
Sampling was performed by transbronchial needle aspiration using a 22-gauge needle.

Lymph Nodes Inspected: 4R, 4L, 7, 11Rs, 11Ri, 11L.

Stations Sampled:

Station 11L:
Size/Appearance: ≥10 mm on CT and hypermetabolic via PET-CT.
Sampling: 4 EBUS-guided TBNA biopsies obtained.
ROSE: Preliminary cytology reported as adequate and suggestive of Granulomas.

Station 7 (Subcarinal):
Size/Appearance: ≥10 mm on CT and hypermetabolic via PET-CT.
Sampling: 4 EBUS-guided TBNA biopsies obtained.
ROSE: Preliminary cytology reported as adequate and suggestive of Granulomas.

Station 11Ri:
Size/Appearance: ≥10 mm on CT and hypermetabolic via PET-CT.
Sampling: 3 EBUS-guided TBNA biopsies obtained.
ROSE: Preliminary cytology reported as inadequate or blood only.

Overall ROSE Diagnosis: Granulomas.
Final Results: Pending.

Bronchoalveolar Lavage (BAL) Bronchial alveolar lavage was performed at the Lateral Segment of RML (RB4) and Medial Segment of RML (RB5).
Instilled 60 cc of NS, suction returned with 49 cc of NS.
Samples sent for Cell Count, Microbiology (Cultures/Viral/Fungal), and Cytology.

Completion The patient tolerated the procedure well.
There were no immediate complications. At the conclusion of the operation, the patient was extubated in the operating room and transported to the recovery room in stable condition.

SPECIMENS
EBUS-TBNA: Station 11L, Station 7 (Subcarinal), Station 11Ri
RML Bronchoalveolar lavage

IMPRESSION / PLAN
59-year-old male who presents for bronchoscopy for lymphadenopathy.
EBUS-TBNA performed on stations Station 11L, Station 7 (Subcarinal), Station 11Ri; ROSE suggestive of Granulomas at sampled stations.
BAL performed in RML.
Follow up bronchoscopic lab work.
